description: Use the Admin API to create and manage users and groups for a domain, along with their aliases. Programmatically access the functionality found at the Admin console Organization and users tab.
steps: Go to Google Developers Console https://console.developers.google.com/
Select a project, or create a new one.
Press Continue to activate API key.
In the sidebar on the left, select Credentials
If your project has no API key for the server, create it now - Add credentials > API key > Server key
After receiving code from the user, please use getAccesToken block

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Exchange code for access token.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The client ID that you obtain from the API Console, as described in Obtain OAuth 2.0 credentials.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: The client secret that you obtain from the API Console, as described in Obtain OAuth 2.0 credentials.

args.name: code
args.info: The authorization code that is returned from the initial request.

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: The URI that you specify in the API Console, as described in Set a redirect URI.

blocks.name: deleteAsps
blocks.description: Delete an ASP issued by a user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: aspsId
args.info: The unique ID of the ASP to be deleted.

args.name: userKey
args.info: Identifies the user in the API request. The value can be the user's primary email address, alias email address, or unique user ID.

blocks.name: getAsps
blocks.description: Get information about an ASP issued by a user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: aspsId
args.info: The unique ID of the ASP to be deleted.

args.name: userKey
args.info: Identifies the user in the API request. The value can be the user's primary email address, alias email address, or unique user ID.

blocks.name: listAsps
blocks.description: List the ASPs issued by a user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: userKey
args.info: Identifies the user in the API request. The value can be the user's primary email address, alias email address, or unique user ID.

blocks.name: stopWatchingResource
blocks.description: Stop watching resources through this channel

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: channelId
args.info: A UUID or similar unique string that identifies this channel.

args.name: resourceId
args.info: An opaque ID that identifies the resource being watched on this channel. Stable across different API versions.

blocks.name: makeActionOnChromeosDevice
blocks.description: Takes an action that affects a Chrome OS Device. This includes deprovisioning, disabling, and re-enabling devices.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: customerId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account.

args.name: deviceId
args.info: An opaque ID that identifies the resource being watched on this channel. Stable across different API versions.

args.name: action
args.info: Action to be taken on the Chrome OS device

args.name: deprovisionReason
args.info: Only used when the action is deprovision.

blocks.name: getSingleChromeosDevice
blocks.description: Retrieves a Chrome OS device's properties.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: customerId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account.

args.name: deviceId
args.info: An opaque ID that identifies the resource being watched on this channel. Stable across different API versions.

args.name: projection
args.info: Determines whether the response contains the full list of properties or only a subset.

blocks.name: listChromeosDevices
blocks.description: Retrieves a paginated list of Chrome OS devices within an account

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: customerId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account.

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Device property to use for sorting results.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of results to return. Default, and maximum, is 100.

args.name: orgUnitPath
args.info: The full path of the organization unit or its unique ID.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: The pageToken query parameter is used to request the next page of query results.

args.name: projection
args.info: Determines whether the response contains the full list of properties or only a subset.

args.name: query
args.info: Search string in the format given at View device information and organizational units

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: Whether to return results in ascending or descending order. Must be used with the orderBy parameter.

blocks.name: moveChromeosDevicesToOu
blocks.description: Move or insert multiple Chrome OS devices to an Organization Unit. You can move up to 50 devices at once.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: customerId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account.

args.name: orgUnitPath
args.info: Full path of the target organization unit or its ID

args.name: deviceIds
args.info: Chrome OS devices to be moved to OU

blocks.name: updateChromeosDevice
blocks.description: Updates a device's annotatedUser, annotatedLocation, or notes properties.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: customerId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account.

args.name: deviceId
args.info: An opaque ID that identifies the resource being watched on this channel. Stable across different API versions.

args.name: projection
args.info: Determines whether the response contains the full list of properties or only a subset.

args.name: annotatedAssetId
args.info: The asset identifier as noted by an administrator or specified during enrollment.

args.name: annotatedLocation
args.info: The address or location of the device as noted by the administrator. Maximum length is 200 characters. Empty values are allowed.

args.name: notes
args.info: Notes about this device added by the administrator. This property can be searched with the list method's query parameter. Maximum length is 500 characters. Empty values are allowed.

args.name: orgUnitPath
args.info: The full parent path with the organization unit's name associated with the device. Path names are case insensitive.

blocks.name: getSingleCustomer
blocks.description: Retrieves a customer.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: customerId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account.

blocks.name: updateCustomer
blocks.description: Updates a customer.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: customerId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account.

args.name: alternateEmail
args.info: The customer's secondary contact email address. This email address cannot be on the same domain as the customerDomain

args.name: customerDomain
args.info: The customer's primary domain name string. Do not include the www prefix when creating a new customer.

args.name: etag
args.info: ETag of the resource.

args.name: language
args.info: The customer's ISO 639-2 language code. See the Language Codes page for the list of supported codes. Valid language codes outside the supported set will be accepted by the API but may lead to unexpected behavior. The default value is en.

args.name: phoneNumber
args.info: The customer's contact phone number in E.164 format.

args.name: postalAddress
args.info: The JSON object with customer's postal address information.

args.name: domainAliasName

args.name: kind
args.info: Kind of the resource.

args.name: parentDomainName
args.info: The parent domain name that the domain alias is associated with. This can either be a primary or secondary domain name within a customer.

args.info: The parent domain name that the domain alias is associated with. This can either be a primary or secondary domain name within a customer.

blocks.name: deleteGroup
blocks.description: Deletes a group.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: groupKey
args.info: Identifies the group in the API request. The value can be the group's email address, group alias, or the unique group ID.

blocks.name: getSingleGroup
blocks.description: Retrieves a group's properties.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: groupKey
args.info: Identifies the group in the API request. The value can be the group's email address, group alias, or the unique group ID.

blocks.name: addGroup
blocks.description: Creates a group.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: email
args.info: The group's email address. If your account has multiple domains, select the appropriate domain for the email address. The email must be unique.

args.name: description
args.info: An extended description to help users determine the purpose of a group.

args.name: name
args.info: The group's display name.

blocks.name: listGroupsByDomain
blocks.description: Retrieves a paginated list of groups in a domain.

args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: domain
args.info: The domain name. Use this field to get fields from only one domain.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of results to return. Default, and maximum, is 200.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Token to specify next page in the list

blocks.name: listGroupsByCustomer
blocks.description: Retrieves a paginated list of groups by customer.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Token to specify next page in the list

args.info: Maximum number of results to return. Default, and maximum, is 200.

args.name: pageToken

args.name: userKey
args.info: The userKey query parameter returns all groups for which a user or group has a membership.

args.name: email
args.info: The group's email address. If your account has multiple domains, select the appropriate domain for the email address. The email must be unique.

args.name: description
args.info: An extended description to help users determine the purpose of a group.

args.name: name
args.info: The group's display name.

args.name: groupKey

args.name: groupKey

args.info: Identifies the group in the API request. The value can be the group's email address, group alias, or the unique group ID.

blocks.name: deleteMember
blocks.description: Removes a member from a group.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: groupKey
args.info: Identifies the group in the API request. The value can be the group's email address, group alias, or the unique group ID.

args.name: memberKey
args.info: Identifies the group member in the API request. A group member can be a user or another group. The value can be the member's (group or user) primary email address, alias, or unique ID.

blocks.name: getSingleMember
blocks.description: Retrieves a group member's properties.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: groupKey
args.info: Identifies the group in the API request. The value can be the group's email address, group alias, or the unique group ID.

args.name: memberKey
args.info: Identifies the group member in the API request. A group member can be a user or another group. The value can be the member's (group or user) primary email address, alias, or unique ID.

blocks.name: addMember
blocks.description: Adds a user to the specified group.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: groupKey
args.info: Identifies the group in the API request. The value can be the group's email address, group alias, or the unique group ID.

args.name: memberKey
args.info: Identifies the group in the API request. The value can be the group's email address, group alias, or the unique group ID.

args.name: email
args.info: Member email address

args.name: role
args.info: The member's role in a group. The API returns an error for cycles in group memberships. For example, if group1 is a member of group2, group2 cannot be a member of group1.

args.name: type
args.info: The type of group member.

blocks.name: listMembers
blocks.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all members in a group.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: groupKey
args.info: Identifies the group in the API request. The value can be the group's email address, group alias, or the unique group ID.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of results to return. Default, and maximum, is 200.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Token to specify next page in the list

args.name: roles
args.info: The member's role in a group. The API returns an error for cycles in group memberships. For example, if group1 is a member of group2, group2 cannot be a member of group1.

blocks.name: updateMember
blocks.description: Retrieves a group member's properties.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: groupKey
args.info: Identifies the group in the API request. The value can be the group's email address, group alias, or the unique group ID.

args.name: memberKey
args.info: Identifies the group member in the API request. A group member can be a user or another group. The value can be the member's (group or user) primary email address, alias, or unique ID.

args.name: role
args.info: The member's role in a group. The API returns an error for cycles in group memberships. For example, if group1 is a member of group2, group2 cannot be a member of group1.

args.name: email
args.info: Member email address

args.name: type
args.info: The type of group member.

args.info: Device property to use for sorting results.

blocks.description: Deletes a notification

args.name: accountId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. The customerId is also returned as part of the Users resource.

args.name: notificationId
args.info: The unique ID of the notification.

blocks.name: getSingleNotification
blocks.description: Retrieves a notification.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: accountId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. The customerId is also returned as part of the Users resource.

args.info: The unique ID of the notification.

blocks.name: listNotifications
blocks.description: Retrieves a list of notifications.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: customerId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of results to return. Default, and maximum, is 100.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: The pageToken query parameter is used to request the next page of query results.

args.name: language
args.info: The ISO 639-1 code of the language notifications are returned in. The default is English (en).

blocks.name: updateNotification
blocks.description: Updates a notification.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: accountId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. The customerId is also returned as part of the Users resource.

args.name: notificationId
args.info: The unique ID of the notification.

args.name: isUnread
args.info: Boolean indicating whether the notification is unread or not.

blocks.name: deleteOrgunit
blocks.description: Removes an organization unit.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: accountId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. The customerId is also returned as part of the Users resource.

args.name: orgUnitPath
args.info: The full path of the organization unit or its unique ID.

blocks.name: getSingleOrgunit
blocks.description: Retrieves an organization unit.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: accountId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. The customerId is also returned as part of the Users resource.

args.name: orgUnitPath
args.info: The full path of the organization unit or its unique ID.

blocks.name: addOrgunitByParentId
blocks.description: Adds an organization unit using parentOrgUnitId.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: accountId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. The customerId is also returned as part of the Users resource.

args.name: name
args.info: The organization unit's path name. For example, an organization unit's name within the /corp/support/sales_support parent path is sales_support.

args.name: blockInheritance
args.info: Determines if a sub-organization unit can inherit the settings of the parent organization. The default value is false, meaning a sub-organization unit inherits the settings of the nearest parent organization unit.

args.name: description
args.info: Description of the organization unit.

args.name: orgUnitPath
args.info: The full path to the organization unit. The orgUnitPath is a derived property.

args.name: parentOrgUnitId
args.info: The unique ID of the parent organization unit.

blocks.name: addOrgunitByParentPath
blocks.description: Adds an organization unit using parentOrgUnitPath.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: accountId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. The customerId is also returned as part of the Users resource.

args.name: name
args.info: The organization unit's path name. For example, an organization unit's name within the /corp/support/sales_support parent path is sales_support.

args.name: blockInheritance
args.info: Determines if a sub-organization unit can inherit the settings of the parent organization. The default value is false, meaning a sub-organization unit inherits the settings of the nearest parent organization unit.

args.name: description
args.info: Description of the organization unit.

args.name: orgUnitPath
args.info: The full path to the organization unit. The orgUnitPath is a derived property.

args.name: parentOrgUnitPath
args.info: The organization unit's parent path. For example, /corp/sales is the parent path for /corp/sales/sales_support organization unit.

blocks.name: listOrgunits
blocks.description: Retrieves a list of all organization units for an account.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: accountId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. The customerId is also returned as part of the Users resource.

args.name: type
args.info: Whether to return all sub-organizations or just immediate children.

args.name: orgUnitPath
args.info: The full path to the organization unit. The orgUnitPath is a derived property.

blocks.name: updateOrgUnit
blocks.description: Updates an organization unit.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: accountId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. The customerId is also returned as part of the Users resource.

args.name: orgUnitPath
args.info: The full path of the organization unit or its unique ID.

args.name: name
args.info: The organization unit's path name. For example, an organization unit's name within the /corp/support/sales_support parent path is sales_support.

args.name: blockInheritance
args.info: Determines if a sub-organization unit can inherit the settings of the parent organization. The default value is false, meaning a sub-organization unit inherits the settings of the nearest parent organization unit.

args.name: description
args.info: Description of the organization unit.

args.name: orgUnitPath
args.info: The full path to the organization unit. The orgUnitPath is a derived property.

args.name: parentOrgUnitId
args.info: The unique ID of the parent organization unit.

args.name: parentOrgUnitPath
args.info: The organization unit's parent path. For example, /corp/sales is the parent path for /corp/sales/sales_support organization unit.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: accountId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. The customerId is also returned as part of the Users resource.

args.name: calendarResourceId
args.info: The unique ID of the calendar resource to delete.

args.name: resourceName
args.info: The name of the calendar resource. For example, Training Room 1A

args.name: resourceDescription
args.info: The brief description of the calendar resource.

args.name: resourceType
args.info: The type of the calendar resource. Used for grouping resources in the calendar user interface.

blocks.name: deleteRoleAssignment
blocks.description: Deletes a calendar resource.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: accountId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. The customerId is also returned as part of the Users resource.

args.name: roleAssignmentId
args.info: Immutable ID of the role assignment.

blocks.name: getRoleAssignment
blocks.description: Retrieve a role assignment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: accountId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. The customerId is also returned as part of the Users resource.

args.name: roleAssignmentId
args.info: Immutable ID of the role assignment.

blocks.name: addRoleAssignment
blocks.description: Creates a role assignment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: accountId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. The customerId is also returned as part of the Users resource.

args.name: assignedTo
args.info: The unique ID of the user this role is assigned to.

args.name: etag
args.info: ETag of the resource.

args.name: orgUnitId
args.info: If the role is restricted to an organizational unit, this contains the ID for the organizational unit the exercise of this role is restricted to.

args.name: roleAssignmentId
args.info: ID of this roleAssignment.

args.name: roleId
args.info: The ID of the role that is assigned.

args.name: scopeType
args.info: The scope in which this role is assigned.

blocks.name: listRoleAssignments
blocks.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all roleAssignments.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: accountId
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. The customerId is also returned as part of the Users resource.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of results to return. Default, and maximum, is 200.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Token to specify next page in the list

args.name: userKey
args.info: The user's primary email address, alias email address, or unique user ID. If included in the request, returns role assignments only for this user.

args.name: roleId
args.info: Immutable ID of a role. If included in the request, returns only role assignments containing this role ID.

blocks.name: deleteToken
blocks.description: Delete all access tokens issued by a user for an application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: userKey
args.info: Identifies the user in the API request. The value can be the user's primary email address, alias email address, or unique user ID.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID of the application the token is issued to.

blocks.name: getSingleToken
blocks.description: Get information about an access token issued by a user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: userKey
args.info: Identifies the user in the API request. The value can be the user's primary email address, alias email address, or unique user ID.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID of the application the token is issued to.

blocks.name: listTokens
blocks.description: Returns the set of tokens specified user has issued to 3rd party applications.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: userKey
args.info: Identifies the user in the API request. The value can be the user's primary email address, alias email address, or unique user ID.

blocks.name: deleteUser
blocks.description: Deletes a user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: userKey
args.info: Identifies the user in the API request. The value can be the user's primary email address, alias email address, or unique user ID.

blocks.name: getSingleUser
blocks.description: Retrieves a user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: userKey
args.info: Identifies the user in the API request. The value can be the user's primary email address, alias email address, or unique user ID.

args.name: customFieldMask
args.info: List of schema names. All fields from these schemas are fetched. This should only be set when projection=custom.

args.name: projection
args.info: Determines whether the response contains the full list of properties or only a subset.

args.name: viewType
args.info: Whether to fetch the administrator-only or domain-wide public view of the user.

blocks.name: addUser
blocks.description: Creates a user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: familyName
args.info: The user's last name. Required when creating a user account.

args.name: givenName
args.info: The user's given name. Required when creating a user account.

args.name: password
args.info: Stores the password for the user account.

args.name: primaryEmail
args.info: The user's primary email address.

args.name: addresses
args.info: The user's addresses

args.name: changePasswordAtNextLogin
args.info: Indicates if the user is forced to change their password at next login.

args.name: emails
args.info: The user's email addresses

args.name: externalIds
args.info: The user's externalIds

args.name: hashFunction
args.info: Stores the hash format of the password property. We recommend sending the password property value as a base 16 bit hexadecimal-encoded hash value. Set the hashFunction values as either the SHA-1, MD5, or CRYPT hash format.

args.name: ims
args.info: The user's ims

args.name: includeInGlobalAddressList
args.info: Indicates if the user's profile is visible in the G Suite global address list when the contact sharing feature is enabled for the domain.

args.name: ipWhitelisted
args.info: If true, the user's IP address is white listed.

args.name: locations
args.info: The user's locations

args.name: notesContentType
args.info: Content type of note, either plain text or HTML. Default is plain text.

args.name: notesValue
args.info: Contents of notes.

args.name: orgUnitPath
args.info: The full path of the parent organization associated with the user. If the parent organization is the top-level, it is represented as a forward slash (/).

args.name: organizations
args.info: List of organizations the user belongs to.

args.name: phones
args.info: List of phones the user has

args.name: posixAccounts
args.info: List of posixAccounts the user has

args.name: relations
args.info: A list of the user's relationships to other users.

args.name: sshPublicKeys
args.info: A list of SSH public keys.

args.name: suspended
args.info: Indicates if the user is suspended.

args.name: websites
args.info: Websites of the user.

blocks.name: listUsersByDomain
blocks.description: Retrieves a paginated list of either deleted users or all users in a domain.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: customFieldMask
args.info: List of schema names. All fields from these schemas are fetched. This should only be set when projection=custom.

args.name: domain
args.info: The domain name. Use this field to get fields from only one domain.

args.name: projection
args.info: Determines whether the response contains the full list of properties or only a subset.

args.name: viewType
args.info: Whether to fetch the administrator-only or domain-wide public view of the user.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of results to return. Default, and maximum, is 200.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Token to specify next page in the list

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Property to use for sorting results.

args.name: query
args.info: Query string for searching user fields.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: Whether to return results in ascending or descending order. Must be used with the orderBy parameter.

args.name: showDeleted
args.info: If set to true retrieves the list of deleted users. Default is false

blocks.name: listUsersByCustomer
blocks.description: Retrieves a paginated list of either deleted users or all users by customer

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: customFieldMask
args.info: List of schema names. All fields from these schemas are fetched. This should only be set when projection=custom.

args.name: customer
args.info: The unique ID for the customer's G Suite account. In case of a multi-domain account, to fetch all groups for a customer, fill this field instead of domain.

args.name: projection
args.info: Determines whether the response contains the full list of properties or only a subset.

args.name: viewType
args.info: Whether to fetch the administrator-only or domain-wide public view of the user.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of results to return. Default, and maximum, is 200.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Token to specify next page in the list

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Property to use for sorting results.

args.name: query
args.info: Query string for searching user fields.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: Whether to return results in ascending or descending order. Must be used with the orderBy parameter.

args.name: showDeleted
args.info: If set to true retrieves the list of deleted users. Default is false
